dataCsv.Site_Description: The Herman Hettler is badly broken and the site consists of two separate major wreckage fields shown in the two separate models. Site one is the bottom of the stern of the ship showing part of the engine bed and a side of the ship and rudder. Site two includes a small piece of the side of the ship plus a major collection of mostly broken ship machinery parts including the engine cylinders, boilers, valves, connecting rods, crank shaft, piping, heating radiators, lifeboat davits, a toilet, and bathtub.
